meanings.definition: Not achieving maximum productivity or efficiency.
meanings.sent1: The old machine was so inefficients that it took twice as long to finish the job.
meanings.sent2: The inefficients process led to delays in completing the project.
meanings.sent3: The inefficients printer decided to take a nap in the middle of printing important documents.
meanings.sent4: Her inefficients time management skills were like trying to fill a leaky bucket.
meanings.sent5: The inefficients system was like a car running on three wheels, struggling to keep up with the others.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is not efficient.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was labeled as an inefficients due to their constant mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The inefficients in the office were slowing down the entire team's progress.
meanings.sent3: The inefficients vacuum cleaner decided to blow dust instead of sucking it in.
meanings.sent4: The old computer was an inefficients, always crashing at the worst times.
meanings.sent5: The inefficients of the group was like a broken cog in a well-oiled machine, disrupting the smooth operation.
